name: illusive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not real and based on illusion (= ideas or beliefs that are not true): It is an illusive place where nothing is as it seems. Feeling and emotion are not to be trusted, as they are too subjective, too illusive.
More examplesFewer examplesIn many areas, sustainable development has become an illusive, utopian proposition.In reality, it appears that the notion of a part-time career is illusive, and the workplace remains dominated by a culture of long hours.The author calls to attention the illusive nature of the nation state.
